column1: 4.1.4.2.1.4	Summary of evidence and recommendations for anticholinergic drugs

Offer anticholinergic drugs to woman with overactive bladder (OAB) who fail conservative 
treatment.
Consider extended-release formulations of anticholinergic drugs whenever possible.

If an anticholinergic treatment proves ineffective, consider dose escalation, offering an 
alternative anticholinergic formulation, or the use of mirabegron (alone or in combination 
with an anticholinergic).

Encourage early review (of efficacy and adverse effects) of patients on anticholinergic 
medication for OAB.
